Data.FoundationSchool: North West of England Foundation School
Data.EmployerTrust: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Data.Specialties: Emergency Medicine, General practice, General psychiatry, General Surgery, Geriatric Medicine, Otolaryngology
Data.ProgrammeTitle: Foundation Priority Programme
Data.ProgrammeDescription: A full 2 year  Foundation Priority Programme at Blackpool. This programme information is indicative only and may be subject to further changes by NHS England and the employer due to operational service changes between August 2024 and August 2025.Tasters would be available in Cardiothoracic Surgery (Lancashire Cardiac Centre). Funding would be available from the trust for modules to study for a PG certificate in Medical Leadership, Medical Education or other relevant to health care. There would also be the opportunity to take part in Simulation & local training.

Data.Specialties: Academic - Education, Emergency Medicine, Endocrinology and Diabetes Mellitus, Gastroenterology, General Practice, Vascular Surgery
Data.ProgrammeTitle: Specialised Foundation Programme
Data.ProgrammeDescription: A full 2 year Specialised Foundation Programme at Aintree with a focus on Academic-Education. This programme information is indicative only and may be subject to further changes by NHS England and the employer due to operational service changes between August 2024 and August 2025.Study leave will be given in FY1 to allow you to attend SFP teaching sessions and to plan your academic project in FY2. This track also includes enrolment onto the PGCert in Teaching and Learning at Edge Hill University

Data.FoundationSchool: Peninsula Foundation School
Data.EmployerTrust: Torbay And South Devon NHS Foundation Trust
Data.Specialties: Academic - Management and Leadership, Acute Internal Medicine, General Surgery, Respiratory Medicine
Data.ProgrammeTitle: F1 and F2: South Devon Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Data.ProgrammeDescription: ACADEMIC FPP programme, offering the chance to study for a PG Cert in either Medical Education or Leadership & Management, Diplomas considered up to maximum of 60 credits (approxiamately funded) WE DO NOT FUND MASTERS. However, you will need to be on track for successful F1 sign off to continue with the Academic component in F2.  F1 placements will be in TORBAY Hospital 3x4 months (Acute Internal Medicine (MAU)/ General Surgery/ Respiratory Medicine).  In F2, the pattern is for 2x6 months clinical posts with time allocated either in-week or in separate clinical/academic weeks depending on the type of programme. One of the 6-month posts will be determined by the trust. For the second 6-month post, each post-holder will be offered a limited choice of clinical specialty, with the final decision dependant on a combination of availability, F1 experience, the requirement to provide a broad training programme and the Foundation Programme Directors view of any individual educational needs. Further information on this two year academic FPP is available on our website. It is important to note that all programmes are subject to change.

Data.FoundationSchool: Peninsula Foundation School
Data.EmployerTrust: Northern Devon Healthcare NHS Trust
Data.Specialties: Acute Internal Medicine, General Practice, General Surgery, Haematology, Respiratory Medicine, Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery
Data.ProgrammeTitle: F1, F2 and F3: Northern Devon Healthcare NHS Trust
Data.ProgrammeDescription: Foundation Priority Programme -This is a 3 year rotation based in Barnstaple for F1 (Acute Internal Medicine(MAU)/General Surgery/General Internal Medicine (Respiratory). F2 based in Barnstaple (General Practice/Haematology/Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery). The F3 year based in Barnstaple will consist of 2 x 6 months working at 80% in for example General Internal Medicine, Trauma & Orthopaedics, Obstetrics & Gynaecology, Paediatrics or Emergency Medicine. The other 20% of the time will be time to develop an area of special interest in either General Practice, Palliative Care, Psychiatry or remote and rural medicine. There will also be the opportunity to develop a sub-speciality interest in Management & Leadership, teaching and education, simulation or quality improvement. It is important to note that all programmes are subject to change.

Data.FoundationSchool: Severn Foundation School
Data.EmployerTrust: Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
Data.Specialties: Cardiology, Emergency medicine, Endocrinology and diabetes mellitus, General practice, General surgery, Trauma and orthopaedic surgery
Data.ProgrammeTitle: FPP SEV019
Data.ProgrammeDescription: This is a Medical Education and Leadership Foundation Priority Programme with F1 and F2 in Yeovil. All FPP-appointed FY1s will be given the opportunity to participate in the Foundation Leadership and Management (FLM) apprentice programme. This is a year-long programme to improve leadership skills with leadership accreditation. To be eligible for this FPP programme, you must have an eligible residency status. Please refer to page 113 of the rules here: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1092603/2223_Provider_Rules_Version_1_Final.pdf. During FY2 successful applicants will have a rostered afternoon per week (pro rata) to develop their Educational Leadership skills supervised by the Foundation Programme Director. They will be actively involved in the postgraduate education department.  They will attend the weekly medical education meeting and be involved in the education away days.  They will take a lead role in the organisation and implementation of the F1 and F2 teaching programme as well as Grand rounds.  They will have a strategic role in enhancing medical education throughout YDH with consideration made to running courses.  They will complete a distance learning Postgraduate Certificate in Medical education at Bristol University.

Data.FoundationSchool: Severn Foundation School
Data.EmployerTrust: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Data.Specialties: Acute internal medicine, Emergency medicine, Gastroenterology, General practice, General surgery, Paediatrics, Trauma and orthopaedic surgery, Urology
Data.ProgrammeTitle: FPP SEV182
Data.ProgrammeDescription: Three year Foundation Programme. F1 GWH Swindon - Urology (Breast & Urology), Gastroenterology, Colorectal surgery; F2 GWH Swindon - Year 1: Acute Internal Medicine, Emergency medicine, Trauma and Orthopaedics; Year 2: Paediatrics, General Practice, Geriatric Medicine. This is an innovative post in which we are offering trainees the opportunity to undertake the FY2 year as a 50% Clinical and 50% Educational post over two years (combined F1 and F2 programme length of 3 years). The 50% Educational element can be tailored to the interests and training needs of the applicants and has 3 main strands or work. 1) Quality Improvement (QI) Projects. The trainee will have the opportunity to lead a quality improvement project with a team of other trainees. The 2 year programme will allow successful applicants to become involved in a longer term project within the Trust that will have long lasting and sustainable outcomes for patient care. Training will be provided by the Foundation QI Lead and Clinical Innovation Fellows with an aim to present the project at a Regional or National Conference and publish in a peer reviewed journal. 2) Education. Opportunity to undertake a funded postgraduate teaching qualification. Assist with the delivery of teaching to F1 doctors and Trust simulation teaching. Training on simulation will be provided. 3) Pastoral support. Assist the Trust pastoral leads in supporting the F1 doctors through the Foundation doctors mentoring programme and organising team building events.  **All FP  programmes are subject to change in relation to placement order, specialty, length, site and Trust.**
